{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3128547,"name":"Jacob","username":"JDM2024","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/7bcc69/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-18T00:40:08.173Z","cooked":"

Hi!

We got a new OpenMesh radio for our 2023 bot. I downloaded the FRC Radio Configuration Application and was having some issues flashing the firmware. I had our radio connected to power through the power Ethernet port on the radio, and I had an Ethernet cord connected to my PC through an Ethernet-USB adapter. I disabled all connections in my control panel besides Ethernet 3 which my windows settings claimed was being used. I entered our team number and then clicked the load firmware button and turned on the power to my radio via a switch to be met with error messages usually consisting of something along the lines of couldn’t connect to the wireless bridge (I don’t have the error message in front of me now), and it would tell me to restart the radio.

Does anyone have any suggestions for what I should try to load the firmware onto our radio to be able to configure it? Thank you so much for your help!

Does your error message look like this? If so, we’re facing the same problem. I’ll be into your post in case you solve it too.

Newer versions of Windows often have virtual network adapters (e.g. for VPN or HyperV). You might need to go to “show hidden devices” or similar in Control Panel to see them all to disable them.

In addition to disabling all other network adapters, including Wi-Fi, try run as Administrator.

Disabling Wifi, Bluetooth and then every Network Adapter in Windows Device Manager (including the ~8 WAN Miniports) finally worked for Radio Firmware flash and config. Thanks for the advice.
